title: ODF Sanitation and Hygiene Household Survey – Ntchisi & Dowa District 2019
text: dataset collected part Open Defecation Free (ODF) Verification Exercise conducted 2019 across selected Traditional Authorities (TAs) Dowa Ntchisi districts Malawi. data gathered using mWater platform coordination BASEflow, Malawian NGO focused strengthening sustainable access water, sanitation, hygiene (WASH). dataset includes household-level observations sanitation facility types, hygiene practices, menstrual hygiene management (MHM). captures availability, usage, quality latrines, handwashing facilities, bathing areas—along behavioral indicators like privacy, safety, waste disposal practices. goal assess whether communities met conditions ODF certification. Potential Use Cases dataset may useful : WASH Practitioners NGOs monitor sanitation coverage, identify behavior change needs, design targeted interventions rural settings. Government Agencies District Councils evidence validating ODF status, planning sanitation improvements, aligning national sanitation strategies. Researchers Public Health Experts study sanitation behavior, infrastructure gaps, impact community health hygiene. Development Partners Donors track progress towards SDG 6 (Clean Water Sanitation), evaluate past investments, guide future funding priorities. Advocacy Communication Specialists develop localized messaging campaigns promoting sustained use improved sanitation hygiene practices.

title: ODF Sanitation and Hygiene Household Survey – Ntchisi & Dowa District 2019
code: library(dowaodfsurvey)  # Visualization: Sanitation vs Proximity to Water (Grouped Bar Chart) # Purpose: Important for understanding contamination risk and public health safety. # Load necessary libraries library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) library(readr)  # Step 1: Load your package library(dowaodfsurvey)  # Step 2: Clean and prepare data data_clean <- dowaodf %>%   filter(     !is.na(sanitation_type),     sanitation_type != "No toilet", sanitation_type != "NA"   ) %>%   mutate(     sanitation_type = as.factor(sanitation_type),     sanitation_near_water = as.factor(sanitation_near_water)   )  # Step 3: Group and count data summary_data <- data_clean %>%   group_by(sanitation_type, sanitation_near_water) %>%   summarise(count = n(), .groups = "drop")  # Step 4: Plot grouped bar chart ggplot(summary_data, aes(x = sanitation_type, y = count, fill = sanitation_near_water)) +   geom_bar(stat = "identity", position = "dodge") +   labs(     title = "Sanitation Type vs Proximity to Water Source",     x = "Sanitation Type",     y = "Number of Facilities",     fill = "Sanitation Near Water"   ) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 30, hjust = 1))

title: ODF Sanitation and Hygiene Household Survey – Ntchisi & Dowa District 2019 — dowaodf
text: dataset contains results household-level WASH (Water, Sanitation, Hygiene) survey conducted July 1st, 2019 Mduku GVH, Dowa District, within catchment area Mbingwa Health Centre, Malawi. purpose survey assess sanitation infrastructure, hygiene practices, menstrual hygiene management (MHM) part Open Defecation Free (ODF) verification exercise.
